sentences.english: This is the eighth cause, proximate and remote, of the appearance of a mighty earthquake. (07).
sentences.chinese: 这是第三个原因，近因和远因，是大地震的出现。

sentences.english: This is the fourth cause, proximate and remote, of the appearance of a mighty earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 这是第四个原因，近因和远因，是大地震的出现。

sentences.english: This is the third cause, proximate and remote, of the appearance of a mighty earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 这是第一个原因，近因和远因，是强大的地震出现。

sentences.english: This is the seventh cause, proximate and remote, of the appearance of a mighty earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 这是第五个原因，近因和远因，是大地震的出现。

sentences.english: Under a number of statutes, the felony must be a proximate cause of the death.
sentences.chinese: 在很多法律规定下，该重罪必须是导致死亡的近因。

sentences.english: The proximate causes of this recovery are traditional.
sentences.chinese: 本次复苏的“近因”是传统性的。

sentences.english: Finally, the article discussed the characters of the recency effects.
sentences.chinese: 文章最后对近因效应的性质进行了讨论。

sentences.english: This is the fifth cause, proximate and remote, of the appearance of a mighty earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 这是第五个原因，近因和远因，是大地震的出现。

sentences.english: In law, the proximate, not the remote cause is regarded.
sentences.chinese: 法律只究近因，不问远因。

sentences.english: However, in our law the principle of proximate cause is not not clear.
sentences.chinese: 然而在我国法律中近因原则均未得以没有明确的规定。

definition: main content/matter/work/origin of an incident/cause/purpose/subject (of business letter)
to such an extent as to/down to/up to
to infer/to consider and come to a judgment/to recommend/to estimate/deduced to be
to become accustomed to sth through long practice
